title: Lesson 1: Foundations of Japanese Vocabulary
description: Build a strong base in essential vocabulary for everyday life.

steps.title: Step 1: Greetings and Basic Expressions
steps.content: Learn common greetings and polite expressions.

vocabularies.whenToSay: Use this to greet someone during the day (Hello).
Say this to thank someone (Thank you).

steps.title: Step 2: Numbers and Counting
steps.content: Learn numbers and age-related terms.

vocabularies.whenToSay: Use this to say the number 1.
Use this to say the number 2.
Use this to say the number 3.

steps.title: Step 3: Everyday Objects
steps.content: Learn words for common everyday items.

vocabularies.whenToSay: Use this to refer to a book.
Use this to refer to a car.
Use this to refer to a clock or watch.

steps.title: Step 4: Family and Relationships
steps.content: Learn words for family members and relationships.

vocabularies.whenToSay: Use this to refer to your mother.
Use this to refer to your father.
Use this to refer to your older brother.

steps.title: Step 5: Complete the Course
steps.content: Congratulations on completing the course!

title: Lesson 2: Everyday Life Vocabulary
description: Learn essential words for navigating daily activities.
content: This lesson covers daily routines, family terms, and places around town.

steps.title: Step 1: Daily Routines and Activities
steps.content: Learn vocabulary for daily activities like 食べる (taberu - to eat), 飲む (nomu - to drink), and 行く (iku - to go), as well as time-related expressions such as 今 (ima - now) and 今日 (kyou - today).

questions.question: What is the Japanese word for 'to eat'?
How do you say 'now' in Japanese?

steps.title: Step 2: Family and Relationships
steps.content: Learn family terms like 母 (haha - mother) and 父 (chichi - father), along with honorific forms like お母さん (okaasan - mother, formal).

questions.question: What is the honorific term for 'mother'?
What does '父 (chichi)' mean?

steps.title: Step 3: Places Around Town
steps.content: Expand vocabulary with words like 駅 (eki - station) and 学校 (gakkou - school), and practice directional phrases like 右 (migi - right) and 左 (hidari - left).

questions.question: What is the Japanese word for 'station'?
How do you say 'right' in Japanese?

steps.title: Step 4: Practice Tasks
steps.content: Write a short paragraph describing your daily routine and practice asking for directions.

title: Lesson 3: Food and Shopping Vocabulary
description: Understand words and phrases for food, dining, and shopping.
content: This lesson focuses on food-related vocabulary and phrases for shopping and payments.

steps.title: Step 1: Food Vocabulary
steps.content: Learn common food items like ご飯 (gohan - rice), 肉 (niku - meat), and 野菜 (yasai - vegetables), and phrases like 美味しい (oishii - delicious).

questions.question: What is the Japanese word for 'rice'?
How do you say 'delicious' in Japanese?

steps.title: Step 2: Shopping Terms
steps.content: Understand terms like 値段 (nedan - price) and 買う (kau - to buy), and phrases like いくらですか？ (Ikura desu ka? - How much is it?).

questions.question: What does '値段 (nedan)' mean?
What is the meaning of 'いくらですか？ (Ikura desu ka?)'?

steps.title: Step 3: Currency and Payment
steps.content: Learn currency-related terms like 千円 (sen'en - 1000 yen) and basic math for calculating totals.

questions.question: What does '千円 (sen'en)' mean?
How do you say 'yen' in Japanese?

steps.title: Step 4: Practice Tasks
steps.content: Role-play ordering food in a restaurant and simulate shopping for items in a store.

title: Lesson 4: Travel and Communication Vocabulary
description: Prepare learners for traveling and engaging with Japanese speakers.
content: This lesson covers transportation, lodging, and emergency vocabulary.

steps.title: Step 1: Transportation
steps.content: Learn terms like 飛行機 (hikouki - airplane) and 電車 (densha - train), and phrases like どこですか？ (Doko desu ka? - Where is it?).

questions.question: What does '電車 (densha)' mean?
How do you say 'Where is it?' in Japanese?

steps.title: Step 2: Lodging and Accommodation
steps.content: Learn words like ホテル (hoteru - hotel) and 部屋 (heya - room), and phrases like 部屋がありますか？ (Heya ga arimasu ka? - Do you have a room?).

questions.question: What is the Japanese word for 'room'?
How do you ask 'Do you have a room?' in Japanese?
options: 部屋がありますか？ (Heya ga arimasu ka?)
questions.answer: 部屋がありますか？ (Heya ga arimasu ka?)

steps.title: Step 3: Emergency Situations
steps.content: Learn emergency-related vocabulary like 病院 (byouin - hospital) and 警察 (keisatsu - police), and phrases like 助けてください！ (Tasukete kudasai! - Please help!).

questions.question: What does '警察 (keisatsu)' mean?
How do you say 'Please help!' in Japanese?

steps.title: Step 4: Practice Tasks
steps.content: Simulate booking a hotel room and practice asking for help in emergencies.

title: Lesson 5: Advanced Vocabulary and Cultural Nuances
description: Expand vocabulary and understand cultural contexts.
content: This lesson explores idiomatic expressions, hobbies, and cultural phrases.

steps.title: Step 1: Idiomatic Expressions
steps.content: Learn phrases like 頑張って (ganbatte - Good luck) and よろしくお願いします (yoroshiku onegaishimasu - Please take care of me).

questions.question: What does '頑張って (ganbatte)' mean?
How do you say 'Please take care of me' in Japanese?
options: よろしくお願いします (yoroshiku onegaishimasu)
どうもありがとう (doumo arigatou)
questions.answer: よろしくお願いします (yoroshiku onegaishimasu)

steps.title: Step 2: Hobbies and Interests
steps.content: Explore vocabulary like 音楽 (ongaku - music) and 映画 (eiga - movie), and practice phrases like 好きですか？ (Suki desu ka? - Do you like it?).

questions.question: What is the Japanese word for 'movie'?
How do you ask 'Do you like it?' in Japanese?
options: 大丈夫ですか？ (Daijoubu desu ka?)

steps.title: Step 3: Cultural Phrases and Etiquette
steps.content: Learn expressions of gratitude like ご馳走様 (gochisousama - Thank you for the meal) and apologies like すみません (sumimasen - Excuse me).

questions.question: What does 'ご馳走様 (gochisousama)' mean?
How do you say 'Excuse me' in Japanese?

steps.title: Step 4: Practice Tasks
steps.content: Write a short paragraph about your favorite hobby and discuss cultural differences using learned vocabulary.

title: Lesson 6: Practical Application and Immersion
description: Use acquired vocabulary in real-life scenarios.
content: This lesson focuses on practical usage of vocabulary through conversations, media, and creative tasks.

steps.title: Step 1: Conversational Practice
steps.content: Role-play scenarios such as ordering food, asking for directions, and introducing yourself.

questions.question: How do you say 'Where is the station?' in Japanese?
options: 駅はどこですか？ (Eki wa doko desu ka?)
電車はどこですか？ (Densha wa doko desu ka?)
食べ物はどこですか？ (Tabemono wa doko desu ka?)
questions.answer: 駅はどこですか？ (Eki wa doko desu ka?)

questions.question: What is the Japanese word for 'restaurant'?

steps.title: Step 2: Media and Content
steps.content: Watch a short Japanese show or listen to a song, and identify and translate familiar vocabulary.

questions.question: What does '歌 (uta)' mean?
How do you say 'music' in Japanese?

steps.title: Step 3: Create Your Own Dialogues
steps.content: Write and act out short skits using learned vocabulary.
